questions.question: Which environment handled sudden user traffic the fastest and most efficiently?

options.A. Physical Server: Dev: 'That thing got overwhelmed fast. No scaling, no chance.'
options.B. Virtual Machine: Zara: 'Better than the server, but still took time to spin up.'
options.C. Containerized App: Renzo: 'Correct. It autoscaled in seconds and kept user sessions smooth.'

questions.question: What is one reason physical servers struggled under heavy load?

options.A. They use too much memory: Zara: 'Memory wasn’t the core issue. The bottleneck was how rigid the setup was.'
options.B. They cannot scale quickly: Renzo: 'Correct. Physical servers don’t scale without manual changes.'
options.C. They have too many replicas: Dev: 'Replicas? The server wished it had any.'

questions.question: What does “autoscaling” mean in a containerized environment?

options.A. Adding more apps to the same containe: Zara: 'No, containers are meant to stay focused. One app, one purpose.'
options.B. Restarting the server when it fails: Dev: 'That’s more like panic scaling, not autoscaling.'
options.C. Automatically starting more container: Renzo: 'Correct. Containers scale horizontally to handle load spikes.'

questions.correct: C. Automatically starting more container instances when needed

questions.question: Why did the virtual machine environment take longer to recover?

options.A. It crashed completely: Dev: 'Nope, it stayed alive, just struggled to keep up.'
options.B. It required a manual restart: Zara: 'It did respond automatically, just not fast enough.'
options.C. It took time to start a second VM ins: Renzo: 'Correct. Spinning up a full VM takes longer than launching a new container.'

questions.correct: C. It took time to start a second VM instance

questions.question: Which environment is best suited for modern cloud apps that need to respond quickly to change?

options.A. Physical Servers: Zara: 'Too slow, too static. Fine for legacy, not for cloud native.'
options.B. Virtual Machines: Dev: 'VMs try, but they’re not built for real time flexibility.'
options.C. Containers: Renzo: 'Correct. Containers are lightweight and designed to scale instantly with demand.'
